title: Font to "pass for" this handpainted sign style?
content:
My sister, a skilled faux-finish painter, but not a sign painter, needs a font to use as a template in order to restore and add to the signage for this shop.

The tilde-like cross strokes on the A and the E seem to be distinguishing features to me... any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018052503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Alcove_1_3647.JPG)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018052503im_/http:/typophile.com/files/alcove_2_5451.JPG)
author: John Nolan

comments.content:
This resembles many of the sign-painter fonts that can be found at Letterhead Fonts. Just a quick look came up with [Esoteric](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018052503/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/esoteric3.shtml), which has three variants, including one that I think is fairly similar to your style. There may be others on the site.

- Mike Yanega
